DOC.brief_summary: This single arm study will evaluate the hemoglobin (Hb) increasing effect, safety and tolerability of two-weekly intravenous administration of Mircera in dialysis patients with chronic renal anemia not currently treated with ESAs. Patients will receive intravenous Mircera 0.6 micrograms/kg every 2 weeks for 16 weeks with follow up 2 weeks after the last treatment visit. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and the target sample size is 100-500 individuals.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of Two-Weekly Intravenous Mircera for the Treatment of Dialysis Patients With Chronic Renal Anemia Not Receiving ESA Therapy.
DOC.criteria: male or female patients, >=18 years of age; chronic renal anemia (Hb concentration 8.0g/dL 10.0g/dL); no prior erythropoietin stimulating agent (ESA) therapy. blood transfusion within the previous 4 weeks; poorly controlled hypertension; significant acute or chronic bleeding; active malignant disease; congestive heart failure (NYHA Class IV).
